title: How Brexit could affect Leicester City's transfer business
text:
How Brexit could affect Leicester City's transfer business New FA proposals to be discussed this week could restrict City to 12 overseas players Share Rob Tanner Leicester City Editor 14:00, 13 NOV 2018 Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get Weekday Leicester City FC updates directly to your inbox Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email
Leicester City and the rest of the Premier League clubs could be restricted on the number of overseas players they can name in their squads post Brexit.
The Times report that the FA are set to table proposals that every club must have at least half of their squad made up of home grown players in preparation for Brexit, when EU players could face the same visa issues currently experienced by non-EU players.
The current rules state each squad cannot be made up of more than 17 overseas players, with Manchester City, Tottenham Hotspur, Brighton and Hove Albion, Watford and Huddersfield Town already at the limit. View gallery
City seem well prepared for such a ruling, which will be discussed at a Premier League meeting on Thursday, as they currently possess 13 overseas players and have been producing their own homegrown young players, like Ben Chilwell and Hamza Choudhury.
Players currently classed as homegrown include overseas players who have spent three years in English or Welsh clubsâ€™ academies between the ages of 16 and 21.
